subject: Public Speaking
title: The Imposter Phenomenon on Stage
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Imposter Phenomenon on Stage usable.

hook.text: You stand at the podium thinking: I don't belong here. Someone will figure out I'm not actually an expert.

buildup.text: Imposter syndrome makes speakers feel like frauds, regardless of their actual qualifications or preparation.

discovery.text: Research by Pauline Clance found that up to 70% of people experience imposter feelings at some point in their careers.

twist.text: High achievers are more prone to it. The more you know, the more you realize how much you don't know.

climax.text: Imposter syndrome isn't evidence you're unqualified. It's often evidence you're growing into a bigger role.

punchline.text: Feeling like a fraud? You're probably just learning.

quiz.question: Who is most prone to imposter syndrome?
options: High achievers who are growing into new roles
